issue.title: [Feature] codegen: choose between multiple generated selectors
issue.body:
In some cases the generated selector isn't stable enough for rerunning the code.

Having multiple selectors per element could solve this, similar to how testim.io does this - https://help.testim.io/docs/working-with-locators#:~:text=Testim%20Smart%20Locators%20are%20a,application%20to%20write%20the%20tests.

comment.body: Another idea: Add a configuration option that adds all the alternative selectors as commented-out code in the generated code.

issue.title: [Feature] Allow mocking of module imports in component testing
issue.body: Feature Request While writing component tests for components in a microfrontend architecture, there can be cases in which there is a requirement to mock methods that are imported in the component which is being tested. Few example of this use case can be as follows: - The component being tested gets the data from indexed db through wrapper methods which are imported in the component. Instead of initializing and populating the indexed db for each component test, it will be much easier if we are able to mock the imported method in the component to get the desired data. - There can be a service which is used across microfrontends that returns data asynchronously. Internally it may or may not make a network request depending on the data being requested. In this scenario, it will be helpful if we are able to mock the imported methods of the service in the component being tested. Do you think others might benefit from this as well? Yes

issue.title: [Question]How to set multi baseurl in one project
issue.body:
Hi. I'm using Playwright(nodejs) to write  test cases.
The test project contains 2 websites. 2 sites depend on each other 
Some cases,I should go to A ,then go to B to assert the function.
How to set 2 different baseURL in one project？

issue.title: [Question] Converting FrameLocator to Locator
issue.body:
Hello,

I have a `FrameLocator` which is being passed to my class from a caller. I use this locator to further locate elements inside it. I would now like to get the bounding box of it, but it seems it is only available on `Locator`.

In the [documentation](https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-framelocator) it says that you can convert a `Locator` to a `FrameLocator`, but how can I do it the other way?
Alternatively, is there a way to call `boundingBox()` on a `FrameLocator` without converting it?

comment.body:
I see, thanks Yury for the quick response. I will approach my issue then by altering it to favor passing Locators over passing FrameLocators.

Appreciate what you're doing with Playwright!

For additional context of future readers of this - `frameLocator.locator(':scope').boundingBox()` did not work for me here because this assumes that the content inside the frame has a viewport height of 100% which it unfortunately doesn't.

issue.title: [BUG] timeout is not working in expect.poll.

comment.body: @yury-s Okay, now my question is when the user can use expect.poll timeout or when should work?

issue.title: [Question] Communication between the Playwright team and the community
issue.body:
Hi everyone!

First of all, thank you for the effort you dedicate to the project and for always being open to suggestions from the community.

I was reviewing the issues that were open under the P3-collecting-feedback tag, I noticed that there are issues that have been open for a long time despite being the most voted, some of them are being worked on (they even have an experimental mode) and others are not .

This leads me to question the following:

1. How does the Playwright team prioritize issues?
2. Is there a public roadmap that can be consulted? Currently, it is only possible to see through the tags which issues will be involved in the next two releases (1.39 and 1.40).
3. I wrote these questions previously in [Discussions](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/discussions/27378), but it went unnoticed. Perhaps it is better to completely deprecate the "Discussions" section considering that it is little used and only use "Issues" and the discord channel. Reducing communication channels will make communication more effective, what do you think?

comment.body:
Here the same - saved some discussion for code examples
https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/discussions/14688

comment.body: @pavelfeldman no offense taken. I think your concerns are definitely valid and official support for Vite with Angular through a plugin would be ideal. I'll leave it up to you all on how you want to proceed from here.
